title: Calories in Pork Tenderloin
meta_description: Learn calories in pork tenderloin per 100g, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition facts for easy meal planning.
assumptions: Lean, separable lean only, roasted without added fat or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, cooking method, added ingredients, and source; check labels or USDA data for precision.

quick_answer.text: 100g of roasted pork tenderloin provides ~143 kcal and ~26g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil for roasting per 100g
Include some visible fat (vs. lean only)
Breaded and pan-fried (adds ~50g breading per 100g meat)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g pork tenderloin?
faqs.a: About 143 kcal for roasted, lean pork tenderloin.

faqs.q: What's the protein in pork tenderloin?

faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain roasted pork tenderloin.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in pork tenderloin?
faqs.a: Roasting keeps it low-cal; frying or adding fat increases by 40â€“150 kcal per 100g.

faqs.q: Is pork tenderloin low in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, lean cuts have ~3.5g total fat and 1.2g saturated fat per 100g.
